alert.note: Alert for Carter (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 23 at 6:43PM MDT until June 23 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 700 PM MDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN CARTER COUNTY... At 643 PM MDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 12 miles southeast of Ekalaka to 11 miles west of Camp Crook to 12 miles northwest of Gustave, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Alzada, Belltower, Capitol and Albion. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for southeastern Montana. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
